Header: Five dead, 60 hurt in Pennsylvania highway crash
Content: At least five people were killed and about 60 injured in a Pennsylvania Turnpike crash involving a tour bus, three tractor-trailers and a passenger vehicle. The National Transportation Safety Board dispatched a team to Mount Pleasant Township, about 64 km southeast of Pittsburgh, to investigate the cause of the pre-dawn pileup. About 60 patients were transported to three area hospitals in Westmoreland County. An 86-mile stretch of the turnpike remained closed New Stanton to Breezewood exits.
